page.title: 02SHERINGHAM YESTERDAY.
page.content: {Sheringham}is mentioned in the first {Domesday Book}but really refers to what is now{Upper Sheringham. Sheringham has been actively connected with the{fishing industry} since{1300, when letters of privilege were granted by the King. The peak period was in the{1880's when 26 large sailing {luggers and 250 small boats}operated from this village. In{1887}the {railway}came and Sheringham ceased to be isolated. Up to{1914}it was a small quiet select resort but after soldiers had been involved with local coastal defence during the{1914-18 war, it became a popular resort and the population increased. Since the Second World War the holiday patterns have changed from long-stay to week-end or week, camping, caravanning and educational school holidays. The local Sheringhamite is a{"Shannock".
